law.text: The following definition applies in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires: "Eavesdrop" means to overhear, record, amplify or transmit any part of a wire or oral communication of others without the consent of at least one (1) party thereto by means of any electronic, mechanical or other device.
law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 226, effective January 1, 1975.
